examples.text: Kartları kim kardıysa bir daha karmasın lütfen.
examples.translation: Whoever shuffled the cards please don't ever shuffle again.

etymology:
From Ottoman Turkish قارمق (karmak, “to meddle, interfere with, disarrange”), from Old Anatolian Turkish [script needed] (kar-, “to mix”), from Proto-Turkic *kār- (“to mix”).
Cognates
Cognate with Karakhanid [script needed] (kar-, “to mix”), Chagatai [script needed] (qarmaq, “to mix”), Chuvash юрма (jurma, “to mix”), Turkmen gārmak (“to mix, shuffle”), Uzbek qormoq (“to mix”).
